questions.question: Anticoagulant used in the test tube for estimating HbA1c?
questions.explanation: Correct Answer: C) EDTA Explanation: EDTA (purple/lavender vacutainer) is the anticoagulant for estimating HbA1c. Vacutainers types Colour Anti-coagulants Uses Purple/Lavender EDTA (Ca2+ chelating anticoagulant) (Option C) CBC, Peripheral Smear, ESR, HbA1c. Light Blue Citrate (Ca2+ chelating anticoagulant). ESR, PT (Prothrombin Time), APTT (Activated Partial Thromboplastin Time), and INR (International Normalized Ratio) Red No anti-coagulant is added Serum studies (blood chemistry, serology, and blood bank testing) Yellow Clot activator/Gel separator Serum tests, such as hormone tests, chemistry panels, and serological tests (LFT, RFT, serum electrolytes) Grey Sodium Fluoride (Option B) Blood Glucose Green Heparin (Option D) ABG, Osmotic fragility, flow cytometry, immunophenotyping Warfarin (Option A) is not an anticoagulant in any vacutainer.

questions.question: Vacutainer used in serum electrolyte estimation:
questions.explanation: Correct Answer: C) Yellow Explanation: Yellow cap vacutainer used in serum electrolyte estimation. questions.question: Which of the following diseases are correctly associated with their respective inclusion bodies?
questions.explanation: Correct Answer: D) Malakoplakia - Michaelis Gutmann bodies Explanation: Michaelis Gutmann bodies are seen in Malakoplakia. Disease Inclusion bodies Rabies Negri bodies are cytoplasmic, round to oval, eosinophilic inclusions found in pyramidal neurons of the hippocampus and Purkinje cells of the cerebellum , sites usually devoid of inflammation. Parkinson’s disease Lewy bodies These are single or multiple, cytoplasmic, eosinophilic, round to elongated inclusions that often have a dense core surrounded by a pale halo. They are composed of fine filaments, densely packed in the core but loose at the rim; these filaments are composed of α -synuclein. Multiple myeloma The globular inclusions are referred to as Russell bodies (if cytoplasmic) or Dutcher bodies (if nuclear). Malakoplakia Michaelis Gutmann bodies: Laminated mineralized concretions resulting from calcium deposition in enlarged lysosomes.
